KSMathRK87.h
1 #ifndef Kassiopeia_KSMathRK87_h_
2 #define Kassiopeia_KSMathRK87_h_
3 
4 #include <limits>
5 
6 #include "KSMathIntegrator.h"
7 
8 #define KSMATHRK87_STAGE 13
9 
10 /*
11 * The number of function evaluations per step is 13 for this method
12 *
13 * The basis for this ODE solver is given in;
14 *
15 * P.J. Prince and J.R. Dormand "High Order Embedded Runge-Kutta Formulae"
16 * Journal of Computational and Applied Mathematics. Vol. 7, pp. 67-75. Mar. 1981
17 *
18 */
19 
20 namespace Kassiopeia
21 {
22 
23  template< class XSystemType >
24  class KSMathRK87 :
25  public KSMathIntegrator< XSystemType >
26  {
27  public:
28  KSMathRK87();
29  virtual ~KSMathRK87();
30 
31  public:
32  typedef XSystemType SystemType;
33  typedef KSMathDifferentiator< SystemType > DifferentiatorType;
34  typedef typename SystemType::ValueType ValueType;
35  typedef typename SystemType::DerivativeType DerivativeType;
36  typedef typename SystemType::ErrorType ErrorType;
37 
38  public:
39  virtual void Integrate( double aTime,
40  const DifferentiatorType& aTerm,
41  const ValueType& anInitialValue,
42  const double& aStep,
43  ValueType& aFinalValue,
44  ErrorType& anError ) const;
45 
46  /*******************************************************************/
47  virtual void ClearState()
48  {
49  fHaveCachedDerivative = false;
50  };
51 
52  //returns true if information valid
53  virtual bool GetInitialDerivative(DerivativeType& derv) const
54  {
55  if(fHaveCachedDerivative)
56  {
57  derv = fDerivatives[0]; return true;
58  }
59  return false;
60  };
61 
62  //returns true if information valid
63  virtual bool GetFinalDerivative(DerivativeType& derv) const
64  {
65  if(fHaveCachedDerivative)
66  {
67  derv = fDerivatives[KSMATHRK87_STAGE]; return true;
68  }
69  return false;
70  };
71 
72  //these functions are provided if the integrator implements
73  //a method to interpolate the solution between initial and final step values
74  //only valid for interpolating values on the last integration step
75  virtual bool HasDenseOutput() const {return false;};
76  virtual void Interpolate(double /*aStepFraction*/, ValueType& /*aValue*/) const;
77 
78  /******************************************************************/
79 
80  private:
81 
82  mutable bool fHaveCachedDerivative;
83  mutable double fIntermediateTime[ KSMATHRK87_STAGE + 1 ];
84  mutable ValueType fValues[ KSMATHRK87_STAGE + 1];
85  mutable DerivativeType fDerivatives[ KSMATHRK87_STAGE + 1 ];
86 
87  static const double fA[ KSMATHRK87_STAGE ][ KSMATHRK87_STAGE ];
88  static const unsigned int fAColumnLimit[ KSMATHRK87_STAGE];
89  static const double fB7[ KSMATHRK87_STAGE ];
90  static const double fB8[ KSMATHRK87_STAGE ];
91  static const double fC[ KSMATHRK87_STAGE ];
92  };
93 
94  template< class XSystemType >
95  KSMathRK87< XSystemType >::KSMathRK87()
96  {
97  for(unsigned int i=0; i<KSMATHRK87_STAGE+1; i++)
98  {
99  fIntermediateTime[i] = std::numeric_limits<double>::quiet_NaN();
100  fValues[i] = std::numeric_limits<double>::quiet_NaN();
101  fDerivatives[i] = std::numeric_limits<double>::quiet_NaN();
102  }
103  fHaveCachedDerivative = false;
104  }
105 
106  template< class XSystemType >
107  KSMathRK87< XSystemType >::~KSMathRK87()
108  {
109  }
110 
111  template< class XSystemType >
112  void KSMathRK87< XSystemType >::Integrate(double aTime, const DifferentiatorType& aTerm, const ValueType& anInitialValue, const double& aStep, ValueType& aFinalValue, ErrorType& anError ) const
113  {
114  //do first stage (0) explicitly to deal with possibility of cached data
115 
116  //init value and time
117  fValues[0] = anInitialValue;
118  fIntermediateTime[0] = aTime;
119 
120  //init solution estimates
121  ValueType y7 = fValues[0];
122  ValueType y8 = fValues[0];
123 
124  //we check if we have cached the derivative from the last step
125  if( fHaveCachedDerivative )
126  {
127  fDerivatives[0] = fDerivatives[KSMATHRK87_STAGE];
128  }
129  else
130  {
131  aTerm.Differentiate( fIntermediateTime[0], fValues[0], fDerivatives[0] );
132  }
133 
134  //add contribution to 7th order estimate
135  y7 = y7 + aStep*fB7[0]*fDerivatives[0];
136  //add contribution to 8th order estimate
137  y8 = y8 + aStep*fB8[0]*fDerivatives[0];
138 
139  //compute the value of each stage and
140  //evaluation of the derivative at each stage
141  for(unsigned int i=1; i<KSMATHRK87_STAGE; i++)
142  {
143  //compute the time of this stage
144  fIntermediateTime[i] = fIntermediateTime[0] + aStep*fC[i];
145 
146  //now compute the stage value
147  fValues[i] = fValues[0];
148  for(unsigned int j=0; j<fAColumnLimit[i]; j++)
149  {
150  fValues[i] = fValues[i] + (aStep*fA[i][j])*fDerivatives[j];
151  }
152 
153  //now compute the derivative term for this stage
154  aTerm.Differentiate(fIntermediateTime[i], fValues[i], fDerivatives[i]);
155 
156  //add contribution to 7th order estimate
157  y7 = y7 + aStep*fB7[i]*fDerivatives[i];
158 
159  //add contribution to 8th order estimate
160  y8 = y8 + aStep*fB8[i]*fDerivatives[i];
161  }
162 
163  //we use the 8th order estimate for the solution (local extrapolation)
164  aFinalValue = y8;
165 
166  //now estimate the truncation error on the step (for stepsize control)
167  anError = y7 - y8;
168 
169  //evaluate the derivative at final point and cache it for the next
170  //step (this derivative is needed for the dense output interpolation)
171  fIntermediateTime[KSMATHRK87_STAGE] = aTime + aStep;
172  aTerm.Differentiate( fIntermediateTime[KSMATHRK87_STAGE], aFinalValue, fDerivatives[KSMATHRK87_STAGE] );
173  fHaveCachedDerivative = true;
174 
175  return;
176  }
177 
178  template< class XSystemType >
179  void KSMathRK87< XSystemType >::Interpolate(double /*aStepFraction*/, ValueType& /*aValue*/) const
180  {
181  //TODO implement this interpolation function
182  }
